data.title: Great food with wonderful service
data.text: Went to KK with a friend I work with. We are always looking for good places to eat while we are on the road. This place was a great find. I love local family owned businesses and this has all the ambience of one. The stone bowl "rice hash"(bibimbap) was phenomenal and the service was great and personable. I love Asian food and this did not disappoint. Highly recommend the KK for lunch or dinner...

data.title: First Time Eating Korean
data.text: This was the first time I've ever eaten Korean food before. I got the spicy pork. Was not very spicy, but it did have a good flavor profile. Will return.

data.title: Best Korean Food In Town
data.text: Korean kitchen gives you the ultimate flavor bang for your buck. Been eating here for years and turned previous non Korean lovers into fans! Everything is so good. They make everything fresh in the kitchen so it may be a bit of a wait but well worth it

data.title: Great!
data.text: Kimchi is fantastic! So is the bulgogi.. I had ginseng tea also.. Very tasty. Customer service is 5 stars,

data.title: Great lunch spot
data.text: This is one of my favorite Korean places in town.  The food is great, portions are large, it is relatively inexpensive and the service is pretty fast.

data.title: Pleasant surprise
data.text: I was in Fort Hood area after 10 years and used trip advisor to find a closer Korean place. During my seven years of living here I drove past it hundreds of times. Nothing to look at from outside. Inside it has about 10 tables in an impeccable clean dining room. The ladies were extremely pleasant and full of smiles. You can see them cooking your food on the spot. I got the Kimchi soup and of course Yakimandoo. Delicious. Highly recommend this place.

data.title: Special request japchae with chicken!
data.text: Food prepared to order and worth the wait. Yaki mandu is crispy outside and scrumptious inside. The japchae with chicken is hands down worth the stop!!  Mom had the combination plate - yaki mandu, bulgogi and fried rice while brother had the fried squid. Large portions, enough to sample all!!

data.title: Dan the Man
data.text: Ate at the Korean Kitchen tonight. Had the grilled beef ribs with all the kim chi and accouterments. Beef delicious,  but a bit of fat here and there. No beer or wine, only sodas. Food very good and a great value. Tab was about  $19.00 for the soda and the beef ribs.

data.title: Great Kimchi Soup
data.text: This restaurant is a small nondescript place that has been here since the 1970s.  I brought a friend here because I was used to getting good food. The banchan was good, and the kimchi soup was absolutely delicious as usual. My friend ordered their combination plate. The bulgogi was good. The yakimandu was disappointing--definitely not what I have eaten there in the past. When I made the sauce for the mandu, I discovered that the table vinegar is white vinegar, not rice vinegar. The vegetable fried rice was nothing remarkable. The service wasn't very good. The server didn't check back to see if we needed anything. As usual, the place was very clean.

data.title: Nice
data.text: The atmosphere is great and the people there are very nice and friendly there.  The food is definately different but good there.

data.title: Love at First Bite
data.text: The restaurant offers a wonderful variety of authentic Korean dishes that provides something for everyone. As a newbie to Korean cuisine, I especially appreciated that the menu contained pictures of each dish and description so I knew exactly what I was ordering beforehand. The garlic chicken wings are delicious! They are fried perfectly without being too oily and the garlic is subtle, but present. The short ribs was love at first bite. It was tender, juicy, and full of flavor. The fried shrimp entrée is definitely up there as one of the best in my opinion. The shrimp was a little on the fresh side, but the soft, buttery rice made up for it. The side dishes were very enjoyable as well. I like their kimchi much better than the one I had at a different restaurant, and the cold cucumber slices (pickled) was my favorite side dish. This restaurant is also one of the few restaurants in Texas with actually great sweet. As a southern girl, this spoke volumes to me. You can dine in or order your food for take out. I highly recommend this place for newbies getting their feet wet (or their tongues in this case) in Korean cuisine and for those who already have an appreciation for this type of food. The prices are reasonable and you will be a believer if this is your first time.

data.title: great table full of Korean goodies!
data.text: this place is for the ones that love Korean food...the ones that miss Korea or just the right place for lunch, good food, fast and great table full of Korean goodies!

data.title: If you're sick, this will heal you!
data.text: I went there because I was sick ( a cold or something) and wanted something really spicy to see if it clears my nose.  They recommended a soup and something else, I was better within 2 day!!!

data.title: Authentic Korean cooking
data.text: The waitress gives you an option of water or boricha (a cold barley drink)...no extra charge. The food comes out in generous portions with a variety of different kimchee selections in separate bowls for the table to share. They will refill the kimchee if you run out. I like to order the soup bowls when I am not feeling well and the bowl is very large. I can never finish it all. I have had many dishes there, but recommend the beef bulgogi or the bibim bop. It is all good and I have never left disappointed.

data.title: JASON B
data.text: My wife and I along with some friends ate here today and the food and service was outstanding. Before coming I read reviews and nothing but positive comments. I decided to try it out for myself and was not disappointed. I will be coming back. A real hidden gem.

data.title: A Little Pricey But Good
data.text: I have eaten here three or four times.  It is family-run and the food is always good.  Service is attentive but a little slow (perhaps reflecting the care taken preparing the food).  There is only one set of menus, which makes lunch a little pricey.  The food is good, though.

data.title: It is a good place to eat.
data.text: We had sweet and sour pork with  yaki mandu . It was very good. This is a mom and pop restaurant in the old part of town. It was not busy the night we went and  was nice just to sit down in a quiet place and have a good meal.

data.title: Asian food everybody will like
data.text: My Korean-American son-in-law loves this place because of the Kimchee, but I like it because of the variety.  You can choose sushi, Chinese or Japanese standards or habachi cooked to order.  Its good value for a family that has different tastes.  Chopsticks or knife and fork, if you walk out of the Korean Kitchen hungry, you were sleeping while everybody ate.

data.title: Great lunch spot
data.text: From the road, it's easy to mistake this place as only having a walk-up window.  But there is a door, and a small dining room.  #4, the combination plate, has very good bulgogi and terrific yakimandu.  I've only seen one waitress there in the entire 3 months that I have been eating there, but she has it all under control.  If you want Korean for lunch, this is a great choice.

data.title: Great Korean Food and Good Service
data.text:
I am retired from the Army and I haven't had good Korean food since I left Fort Hood, TX in January 1988.  My son and I made a trip across Texas and we had to go to Killeen to look around a few days and to get some good Korean food.  We stopped by Korean Kitchen Saturday afternoon and pulled up to front of the store. Don't let the outside fool you, it may not look like much outside, but food is outstanding.  We ordered  the garlic fried and yaki mandu. and along with it , 8 sides of vegetables each in a separate  bowls, including the Kimchee. The food was some of the best I have ever had.  The cook, waitresses, and staff  were all Korean and all very friendly and provided great service.   If I lived here, I would visited this restaurant once  a week.
..  .
